params.description: options for function call.
params.name: options

params.description: API key, mandatory if autoconf service has not been charged in advance
params.name: options.apiKey

params.description: use of ssl or not (default true, service requested using https protocol)
params.name: options.ssl

params.description: Specify if widget is draggable
params.name: options.draggable

params.description: Specify if MousePosition control should be collapsed at startup. Default is true.
params.name: options.collapsed

params.description:
list of projection systems, default are Geographical ("EPSG:4326"), Web Mercator ("EPSG:3857"), Lambert 93 ("EPSG:2154") and extended Lambert 2 ("EPSG:27572").
     Each array element (=system) is an object with following properties :
params.name: options.systems

params.description: Proj4 crs alias (from proj4 defs). e.g. : "EPSG:4326". Required
params.name: options.systems.crs

params.description: CRS label to be displayed in control. Default is crs code (e.g. "EPSG:4326")
params.name: options.systems.label

params.description: CRS units type for coordinates conversion : "Geographical" or "Metric". Default: "Metric"
params.name: options.systems.type

params.description: Aera covered by the system (WGS84 coordinates).
params.name: options.systems.geoBBox

params.description: Right bound.
params.name: options.systems.geoBBox.right

params.description: Left bound.
params.name: options.systems.geoBBox.left

params.description: Top bound.
params.name: options.systems.geoBBox.top

params.description: Bottom bound.
params.name: options.systems.geoBBox.bottom

params.description:
list of coordinates units, to be displayed in control units list.
     Values may be "DEC" (decimal degrees), "DMS" (sexagecimal), "RAD" (radians) and "GON" (grades) for geographical coordinates,
     and "M" or "KM" for metric coordinates
params.name: options.units

params.description: activate (true) or deactivate (false) the altitude panel. True by default
params.name: options.displayAltitude

params.description: activate (true) or deactivate (false) the coordinates panel. True by default
params.name: options.displayCoordinates

params.description: If true, coordinates from the MousePosition control can be edited by users to re-center the view. False by default.
params.name: options.editCoordinates

params.description: options for position marker
params.name: options.positionMarker

params.description: Marker url (define in src/Openlayers/Controls/Utils/Markers.js)
params.name: options.positionMarker.url

params.description:
Offsets in pixels used when positioning the marker towards targeted point.
     The first element in the array is the horizontal offset. A positive value shifts the marker right.
     The second element in the array is the vertical offset. A positive value shifts the marker down. [0,0] value positions the top-left corner of the marker image to the targeted point.
     Default is offset associated to default marker image.
params.name: options.positionMarker.offset

params.description: if true, marker is not displayed, otherwise displayed (False by default.)
params.name: options.positionMarker.hide

params.description: elevation configuration
params.name: options.altitude

params.description: options of elevation service
params.name: options.altitude.serviceOptions

params.description: latency for altitude request, 500 ms by default
params.name: options.altitude.responseDelay

params.description: immobilisation time of movement on the map to trigger the elevation calculation, 200 ms by default
params.name: options.altitude.triggerDelay

params.description: value used for altitude service no data (default is -99999). In this case, "---m" will be displayed instead of "-99999m"
params.name: options.altitude.noDataValue

params.description:
tolerance for no data value :
                 values in [noDataValue + noDataValueTolerance ; noDataValue - noDataValueTolerance] interval will not be displayed, but "---m" will be displayed instead.
                 Default is 90000 (no data values = [-9999 ; -189999])
params.name: options.altitude.noDataValueTolerance
